Name: Angela Likina
Description:
Angela was stabbed by a man who had come to visit her ex-wife. After being stabbed she managed to reach a neighbour and tell them who did it. 

Although an ambulance was called, it was too late.

> According to the acquaintance, Angela was often beaten by strangers, but her neighbors treated her calmly and respected her choice.

TvT project: Ufa1 & 24smi, 02.02.2016

Name: Jessica Riascos
Description: TvT partner organisation Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans & Periodico La ultima, 01.02.2016

Name: Kayden Clarke
Description:
Kayden died in hospital after being shot by police officers while suffering a mental health crisis. They had came to his home following a suicide call.

> Two Mesa police officers who shot and killed a 24-year-old woman with Asperger syndrome have been placed on administrative leave while officials investigate, it was announced this afternoon.
>
> “We don’t know at this point why they made the decision to go lethal,” police spokesman Esteban Flores told reporters.
>
> Three officers went to [deadname] Jacob's home Thursday after a friend alerted police that [he] was suicidal. When they entered [his] apartment near 80th Street and Brown Road, Jacobs came out of the back bedroom holding a kitchen knife with an eight-inch blade.
>
> One officer returned to the police car to get a beanbag gun, hoping to avoid using lethal force, while the other two attempted to “de-escalate the situation,” he said. When Jacobs lunged toward officers, both fired their guns. Flores declined to say how many times [he] was shot.
>
> Jacobs posted a popular online video last year attempting to raise awareness about the difficulties of living with Asperger syndrome, a high-functioning form of autism. In the video, which was viewed more than 2.4 million times, Jacobs’ sobbed and struck [himself] while [his] Rottweiler tried to comfort her. The dog, named Samson, used his paws to block [him] from hitting [himself].
>
Jacobs adopted Samson from Halo Animal Rescue in Phoenix in 2011 and trained him to assist [him].
>
> "When I have a meltdown, I often have self-injurious behavior and I often self-harm," [he] told the Huffington Post after the video went viral.

In December, Kayden had posted a video in which he announced that his insurance would pay for his reassignment surgery. "I'm so happy," he said.

TvT project: Huffington Post & The Advocate, 06.02.2016

Name: Cristina Iniciarte Iniciarte
Description:
Cristina was shot by the occupants of a car. Her body was found in the street.

> Early this Friday morning, a [trans woman] was shot to the head on Avenida 5 de Julio in Maracaibo, in the vicinity of Bingo Maracaibo.
>
> Preliminary information indicates that the victim was known as "Cristina" and that she worked alongside other [trans women] offering sexual services.
>
> The victim was shot from a car and the bullet her in the left of the chest.

Name: Malu
Description:
Malu's body was found in brushwood. She had been shot 9 times.

> Did we kill Malu?
>
> Yesterday February 11, was found dead in a thicket of coconut palms in Maracanaú, Malu, a [trans] woman, was killed with 9 shots. Malu was a [sex worker] and nothing is known about the reason for the crime.

> Malu is another victim of ours, we are guilty yes!
>
> We kill little by little when we don't respect her and her gender identity, when we reinforce the fundamentalist speeches, when we turn our back on her on the street, when we ignore her at the bus stop, at the health center and at school, when we believe we have overcome all forms of prejudice, and we repeat that in Maracanaú there is no such thing, and worse when we do not charge the public power affirmative actions to combat transphobia and the extermination of transvestites and transsexuals in Maracanaú, especially in a city that has a LGBT Coordination.
>
> The society also pulled the trigger and killed Malu.
>
> How many more of our girls will have to die so that we have at least a basic right to citizenship?
What has the public power of this city done to combat the extermination of our population of transvestites and transsexuals?
>
> What actions? Projects? and what did you do to charge these defense agencies? or will you stay there for convenience because it wasn't with you?

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & Facebook, 12.02.2016

https://homofobiamata.wordpress.com/2016/02/11/malu-tiros-ce-maracanau/

https://www.facebook.com/samillamarquesaires/posts/952093571532776

Name: Cicarelli de Carvalho
Description:
Cicarelli was stabbed more than twenty times. Two suspects were arrested, but one was still being looked for.

> The body of a 36-year-old [trans woman] was found early on Tuesday (16), at the corner of ruas José Tadeu Cabral and Eurydice de Barros Esteves, in the Mangabeira neighborhood of João Pessoa. According to the Civil Police, the victim was reportedly killed with more than 20 stab wounds.
>
> Police said residents of the neighborhood left home when they saw the body and no one could explain how the murder happened. In addition to the stab wounds, the victim's right ear was cut and the forensic found a stone beside her body. The object will be analyzed to see if it was used in the crime.
>
> According to the Civil Police, the victim's family members testified and said that the victim had no involvement with any kind of crime and that they do not know the motives for the murder. The case will be investigated by the João Pessoa Homicide Department.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & Jornal da Paraiba, 16.02.2016

Name: D. L. Rabelini Quadros
Description:
The victim was one of two whose bodies were found partially burned. Both had their hands tied and showed signs of torture.

> Two [trans women] were found dead on Friday morning on the Martim Félix Berta Road in northern Porto Alegre. According to the Military Brigade, the bodies were partially burned.
>
> On the back of one of them, police identified a spray-graffiti of the expression "X-9" - criminal slang for whistleblower, "stubby." One of the victims had a wire attached to her neck, which may indicate that the cause of death was asphyxiation. Both had their hands tied.
>
> The 5th DHPP investigators suspect that the two women were not killed there but had their bodies abandoned there. An attempt was made to burn both bodies, but that did not work.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & G1 Globo online, 19.02.2016

Description:
Veronica's body was found in a hotel room by police. She was lying in a bathtub of water fully clothed. Her body showed no obvious signs of trauma.

> “Found out my friend passed away yesterday. I hope this injustice weighs heavy on the conscience of whoever caused you harm. Veronica, you were a good friend to me when I was the new girl in town and I will miss you forever amiga.”

Name: Lucha Zarate Vilcas
Description:
Lucha was shot in the head. In July 2019 Mimoun Moumni, 38, was sentenced to 30 years in prison for her murder.

An appeal in November 2020 confirmed the sentence.
> 
> A 38-year-old man was sentenced this Friday in France to 30 years in prison for the murder of a Peruvian transsexual prostitute in 2016 in the city of Rouen (northwest) and the assault of another, his lawyers told AFP.
> 
> The defendant, Mimoun Moumni, of Moroccan origin, was convicted of the murder of [deadname] Z., 53, who was found dead on the night of February 20, 2016 on the stairs of his property, with a wound in the skull.
> 
> The French investigators thought at first that her death was accidental, since the victim was wearing very high heels. But during the autopsy a very small caliber bullet was found, which the coroner had not seen.
> 
> The Eure (North-West) Court of Appeal followed the recommendations of the Public Prosecutor's Office by confirming the 30-year prison sentence handed down at first instance in July 2019 against Mimoun Moumni.
> 
> The man, who denies being responsible, "is considering filing an appeal before the Court of Cassation," the highest French court, said his lawyers, asking that he be acquitted.
> 
> The accused, who did not speak during the hearing, was also convicted of having stabbed another Peruvian transsexual prostitute six times in 2015.
>
> The latter had crossed paths with her attacker again and noted the license plate number of her vehicle, which she communicated to the police during the investigation into the murder of her compatriot, said Cécile Madeline, a lawyer for the family of the deceased and the prostitute . attacked in 2015.

TvT project: Le Parisien & Normandie, 24.02.2016

Name: Maya Young
Description:
Maya was found on the street suffering from multiple stab wounds to her neck and chest. She died in hospital shortly after midnight.

Tiffany E. Floyd, 25, and Jose Pena, 19, were arrested for her murder. Floyd was sentenced to 8-20 years in jail plus 10 years of probation for third-degree murder. Pena was sentanced to 40-80 years for the first-degree murder of Maya and the unrelated murder of Jonathan Martel. Both had stabbed Maya, but it was the second stabbing by Pena which ultimately killed her.

> Maya Young had a distinctive birthmark: One side of her face was light and the other dark, with a line down the middle separating the brown tones.
> 
> "She looked like chocolate and caramel," said Anthony Harper, a longtime friend and former roommate of the 25-year-old transgender woman. He used to call her "Twix," like the candy bar. "She was sweet, like candy. She loved people and she loved being around people," he said.

After the pair were sentenced Maya's sister said:

> “It’s finally over. It can never bring her back or take away the pain but, at the end of the day, I feel like she can rest better now that justice was served in her favor”.

Maya was the third known transgender woman of color killed in Philadelphia over the course of a year, after Kiesha Jenkins 22, in October 2015, and London Kiki Chanel in May 2015.

TvT project: The Advocate, 23.02.2016

Name: C. Moreira Batista Neves
Description:
C. was stabbed by a man who had hurled unprovoked transphobic insults at her.

> A 25-year-old trans [woman] was stabbed to death in Campina da Lagoa, Midwestern Paraná, in a transphobic attack when a man, unprovoked, began insulting her by calling her 'traveco' and used other profanities. The killer them stabbed the victim in the leg and chest.

Name: Jóse Salazar
Description:
Jóse's body was found found half-naked in the street after she had gone out on a date. She had been beaten and possibly raped.

> The wildly beaten corpse of a 34-year-old Peruvian trans woman appeared abandoned on the street. According to the police, the victim was beaten and raped by a group of people. 
> 
> According to the newspaper Crónica published in its print edition on Tuesday, the macabre finding occurred when members of the 2nd station of Florencio Varela received a complaint, which referred to a dead person on public roads at the junction of 513 and 542, in the mentioned district, in the south of the provincial conurbano . Immediately, the members of the section arrived at the place, an opportunity in which they observed the body without life and upside down that had women's clothes. The deceased was dressed in a top, pollera, high-heeled shoes and underwear that had been lowered at the level of the thighs. The victim also had blows to her face.  
> 
> On Monday afternoon, the deceased was identified by her relatives and in this way it was established that she lived in Florencio Varela, but far from the place where she appeared dead. But this episode has mysterious elements, because the relatives indicated that the victim left his home dressed in other clothes to apparently go to a bar called Hemingway Bar, located on General José de San Martín avenue at 3200, almost corner Bartolomé Miter, in the center of the town. 
> 
> Due to these explanations of the relatives, the investigators analysed images captured by the surveillance cameras of the bar and do not rule out that the possibility that the victim was raped by the attackers, but they await the results of the expert studies.

TvT project: Cronica, 23.02.2016 & Nuevo Diario Web, 21.03.2016

http://varelaaldia.com.ar/un-ano-del-crimen-de-la-jose-un-asesino-anda-suelto-por-una-justicia-que-no-avanza/

The police went to the scene and found the fallen victim. Witnesses said two men in a black car drove down the street and the driver shot the victim at least four times.

Name: Natascha
Description:
Natascha died after two months in hospital. On 27th December 2015, she had been beaten, had gasoline poured over her, and set on fire while on Rua Victor Ferreira do Amaral. 

Before she died she told police that a former client was responsible.

> At dawn on the 27th, the Evangelical Hospital of Curitiba registered the admission of a [trans woman] who had suffered an attempted murder while being between Paulo Kissula and Avenida Vitor Ferreira do Amaral, in the Capão da Imbuia neighborhood. The victim, who is about 36 to 37 years old, had no personal documentation and reported that she was attacked by only one man, who threw gasoline and set her body on fire. 
 >
> Rafaelly Wiest, president of Transgroup Marcela Prado, says he visited Natasha on Tuesday morning and that the signs of violence are heartbreaking. Natasha is still hospitalized and even after surgery is in danger of dying. The case is serious and she needs constant monitoring, dressing changes happen frequently and need to be done in the operating room, with anesthesia usually in a sterile environment. The victim has part of the face, arms and breasts burned, with injuries of 2nd and 3rd degree burns.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & Gazeta do Povo, 24.02.2016

Name: Demarkis Stansberry
Description:
Demarkis was shot in the head by 24-year-old Nicholas Matthews inside Matthews’ home at about 11:30am on Saturday 27th February. He died at the scene.

Matthews turned himself in to local police on the day of the shooting and confessed to the killing.

Matthews originally told the police that he shot Stansberry by accident under the belief that his gun was empty after removing the clip on New Year’s Eve. However, local reports claim that Stansberry was shot at point-blank range with the shooter standing at his side.

He was charged with negligent homicide, illegal use of a weapon, and possession of a firearm by a felon.

> “We are saddened by the loss of Demarkis Stansberry, and send our condolences to his loved ones,” said Emily Waters of the National Coalition of Anti-Violence Programs in a statement. “We are only beginning to see national visibility around the disproportionate violence that transgender people face in this nation. Violence against transgender men has been largely missing from these conversations, and we must encourage a discussion of the unique ways that transgender men experience violence.”
> 
> Elizabeth Anne Jenkins, president of Louisiana Trans Advocates, on her Facebook page said that Stansberry was a member of her organisation.

TvT project: The Advocate, 29.02.2016

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was shot 3 times alongside the edge of the RS-118 highway on the night of Saturday 27th February.

The inquest into her murder determined that her killers were two men on a motorcycle.

> Police begin investigating the mysterious murder of a 27-year-old [trans woman] on the brink of RS-118. The crime happened on Saturday night (27), in the immediate vicinity from km 20 of the state highway. According to police, the victim was hit by at least three shots.
>
> The investigation by the DHPP points out that she was approached by a pair on a "dark" motorcycle near the end of the night. Coming from Sao Leopoldo, the [trans woman] used to use 118 as a "place of work."
